page.title: 15 Gateway to Southampton
page.content:
Southampton has been one of the major gateways to southern Britain. Most people connect Southampton with ships, but the city has much more to offer. The oldest building in the city is St.Michael's Church, known as the 'Archangel'. Built by Norman French settlers and rebuilt in the 15th century, it has a black Tornai marble font, one of the three in Britain. The Tudor House in St. Michael's Square is a fine example of Southampton in the Elizabethan years. The Maritime Museum, Woolhouse, in Bugle Street, is a fine example of a Medieval warehouse; it was used to house French prisoners of war in the 18th and 19th centuries.
Continued on page 16.
